actions.name: Enforce all-repository triage role
actions.description: Enforces the 'All-repository triage' role for all members of the organization, ensuring that eligible users are assigned the role while allowing for a dry-run simulation. It retrieves the current role assignments, checks for existing roles, and updates them as necessary, excluding specified users. A summary report of actions taken is generated at the end.
actions.cron_schedule: at 0 minutes past the hour, at 3:00, on Mon

actions.name: Invite contributors to Armbian ORG
actions.description: Invites eligible contributors to the Armbian organization by collecting PR authors from specified repositories and checking their membership status. It can run in a dry-run mode to simulate invitations without sending them. Displays a summary of eligible users for invitation.
actions.cron_schedule: at 0 minutes past the hour, at 0:00, on Sun

actions.name: Generate base-files package index
actions.description: Generates and updates base-files package index by running a Python script that processes data and commits changes to the repository. It checks out the repository, sets up a Python environment, installs necessary dependencies, and handles version control operations including committing and pushing updates. Additionally, it triggers a directory listing event upon completion.
actions.cron_schedule: at 45 minutes past the hour, at 3:00

actions.name: Generate Armbian download index
actions.description: Generates and updates the Armbian download index by creating a JSON file and compressing torrent files. It retrieves necessary data from multiple repositories, processes it, and commits the results to the GitHub Pages repository. The workflow also includes enrichment of data using external credentials and handles potential Git conflicts during the commit process.

actions.name: Generate build engine inventory
actions.description: Generates and updates image information data by producing an inventory JSON file and committing it to a specified branch in a repository. It checks out necessary repositories, compiles the inventory, and handles potential git operations to ensure updates are pushed correctly.
actions.cron_schedule: at 0 minutes past the hour, every 4 hours

actions.name: Generate Armbian Jira excerpts
actions.description: Generates and updates HTML excerpts from Armbian Jira issues, categorizing them into current and planned releases. Fetches data from Jira using specified credentials, processes it, and writes the output to HTML files. Commits and pushes the changes to a specified branch in the repository if there are updates.
actions.cron_schedule: at 45 minutes past the hour, at 5:00

actions.name: Update partners and maintainers
actions.description: Fetches and generates JSON files for partners and maintainers from Zoho Bigin, then commits and pushes these files to a GitHub repository. It formats the partner data into a structured JSON and summarizes it in a GitHub Actions step summary. Additionally, it enriches maintainer data with GitHub avatars and handles potential git conflicts during the push process.
actions.cron_schedule: at 30 minutes past the hour, at 5:00

actions.name: Update Raspberry Pi imager JSON
actions.description: Generates and updates a JSON index for the Raspberry Pi imager by executing a Python script that creates the file and commits it to the repository if changes are detected. It checks out the relevant branch, installs necessary dependencies, and handles potential merge conflicts during the push process.

actions.name: Update Armbian automation status
actions.description: Generates reports for multiple Armbian repositories by scanning specified directories and compiling data into JSON files. It installs necessary dependencies, restores cached data, and uploads the generated reports as artifacts. Subsequently, it merges these reports into a single index and commits the updates to a designated data branch, triggering a website generation process.

actions.name: Generate board & vendor thumbnails
actions.description: Generates board and vendor thumbnails from specified image directories, processing images to create various sizes and formats. It builds matrices of available boards and vendors, processes images in parallel shards, and uploads the results to cache servers. A summary report is generated to provide insights on the processing outcomes.

actions.name: Generate image build lists
actions.description: Generates image build lists and kernel descriptions for release targets. Downloads image information, processes it with Python scripts, and commits the generated YAML files to a data branch. Summarizes the generated files and handles potential Git conflicts during the commit process.

actions.name: Download keyrings for Debian & Ubuntu
actions.description: Downloads keyring data for Debian and Ubuntu, identifies the latest keyring packages, and updates them in a specified repository. It retrieves package URLs, downloads the files, stages them in the repository, and creates symlinks for easy access. Finally, it commits and pushes any changes made to the repository.
actions.cron_schedule: at 40 minutes past the hour, at 3:00, on Wed

actions.name: Generate motd for Linux OS
actions.description: Generates a message of the day (MOTD) file for Linux OS by extracting data from JSON files and committing the results to a repository. It checks out two repositories, processes the MOTD data, and updates the relevant files if changes are detected. Finally, it triggers another action for further updates.

actions.name: Cache servers JSONs
actions.description: Generates JSON files from NetBox data for server configurations and commits them to a repository. It retrieves information about active virtual machines, categorizes them into download, cache, and upload roles, and formats the output using jq. The generated JSON files are then pushed to a specified branch in the repository.
actions.cron_schedule: at 0 minutes past the hour, at 2:00

actions.name: Update Torrent Trackers
actions.description: Generates and updates a list of torrent trackers by collecting data from a specified repository, formatting it, and committing the results to a data branch. It also triggers a subsequent workflow for web indexing after the update is complete.
actions.cron_schedule: at 0 minutes past the hour, at 4:00

actions.name: Generate github.armbian.com content
actions.description: Generates and deploys content for a web directory on GitHub Pages. Rebuilds the data branch by syncing data and workflow files, generates directory listings, and uploads the content as an artifact. Finally, it deploys the generated content to the GitHub Pages environment and reloads a redirector via SSH.

actions.name: Enable 16 Hetzner ARM64 runners
actions.description: Enables and manages 16 Hetzner ARM64 runners by creating and deleting servers as needed. Generates a matrix for server creation, performs server setup, executes tasks, and ensures cleanup after operations. The process includes checking team membership, preparing the server matrix, and orchestrating server lifecycle management.

actions.name: Mirror artifacts to our CDN
actions.description: Mirrors artifacts from a specified repository to a CDN by splitting JSON data into manageable parts and uploading them. Cleans up older files on the servers while retaining the latest versions. Utilizes SSH for secure file transfers and manages artifact uploads and downloads throughout the process.

actions.name: APT repositories update
actions.description: Updates APT repositories by downloading external packages, generating reports, and managing repository permissions. It includes steps for checking membership, downloading packages, copying files, preparing repositories, and cleaning up input directories. The workflow also handles GPG key imports and repository updates based on the presence of .deb files.

actions.name: Update CDN redirector
actions.description: Updates CDN redirector configurations by downloading and comparing package mirrors from specified sources. It checks permissions, installs dependencies, and mirrors files based on platform types, while generating reports on synchronization status. The workflow also handles artifacts for beta and stable packages, images, and cache, and creates YAML redirector configurations.

actions.name: Validate board images & vendor logos
actions.description: Validates board images and vendor logos by checking their integrity and compliance with specified standards. Installs ImageMagick to perform image validation and executes a custom script for the validation process.
actions.cron_schedule: at 0 minutes past the hour, at 0:00, on day 1

actions.name: Set labels based on PR size
actions.description: Sets labels automatically based on pull request size, file categories, and creation date for quarterly tracking. Removes the 'Ready to merge' label when a pull request is updated. Applies labels according to a predefined configuration and adds size labels based on the number of changed lines.

actions.name: Listen PR review and label it
actions.description: Listens for approved pull request reviews and saves the associated pull request number. Uploads the pull request number as an artifact for further use in the workflow.

actions.name: Set label on PR approval
actions.description: Sets a label on a pull request upon approval by a reviewer. Downloads the pull request number from a previous workflow and applies the 'Ready to merge' label while removing specific review-related labels. Additionally, it comments on the pull request to indicate approval.

actions.name: Synhronize labels
actions.description: Synchronizes labels from a YAML file to issues and pull requests based on defined criteria. It reads the label definitions from '.github/labels.yml' and applies them to relevant issues and pull requests, ensuring consistency in labeling. The operation can be executed in a dry-run mode for pull requests to preview changes before applying them.
actions.execution_method: workflow_dispatch, push to main branch with changes to .github/labels.yml, pull_request with changes to .github/labels.yml

actions.name: Clean workflow logs
actions.description: Cleans up workflow logs by deleting runs older than a specified number of days, helping to manage storage and maintain a tidy environment. It allows for customization of the retention period through inputs during manual execution or defaults to 21 days for scheduled runs.
actions.cron_schedule: at 0 minutes past the hour, at 0:00, on Tue

actions.name: Watchdog
actions.description: Monitors and manages the execution of specified workflows by rerunning failed jobs up to three times. Executes a set of predefined scripts and checks their latest run status, triggering reruns if necessary. Operates on a scheduled basis or can be manually triggered.

actions.name: Self hosted runners status
actions.description: Checks the status of self-hosted runners and generates a summary report. Retrieves runner information from GitHub and virtual machine details from NetBox, compiling the data into an HTML summary. The report includes details on CPU, memory, storage, and runner status.
actions.cron_schedule: at 0 minutes past the hour, at 6:00

actions.name: Release summary
actions.description: Generates a release summary report by fetching merged pull requests from specified repositories over a defined period. Prepares a Markdown digest that includes details of the pull requests and optionally publishes a GitHub release with the summary. Utilizes OpenAI to create a journalistic intro for the report based on the changes.
actions.cron_schedule: at 5 minutes past the hour, at 6:00, on MON

actions.name: Fetch Armbian kernel versions
actions.description: Fetches the latest Armbian kernel versions from the Armbian APT repository and updates SVG badges and JSON data in the 'data' branch. Generates badges for the CURRENT and EDGE kernel versions, and commits these updates to the repository. Ensures the 'data' branch exists and handles version validation and error management throughout the process.
actions.cron_schedule: at 15 minutes past the hour, at 2:00

actions.name: WiFi performance
actions.description: Tests WiFi performance by powering on devices, configuring network settings, and conducting performance tests using iperf. Collects and uploads test results, including device metrics and connection information, for documentation purposes. Merges test results into a markdown file and creates a pull request for updates.
actions.cron_schedule: at 0 minutes past the hour, at 0:00, on SAT
